meanings.definition: To remove from a church or religious organization.
meanings.sent1: The pastor unchurches those who do not attend regularly.
meanings.sent2: She unchurches the old building to make space for a new community center.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel unchurches the acorns from the tree, causing chaos below.
meanings.sent4: The storm unchurches the trees, leaving a path of destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologist carefully unchurches the ancient artifacts, revealing their hidden beauty.

meanings.definition: To cause to lose faith or belief in a church or religion.
meanings.sent1: The controversial book unchurches many of its readers, challenging their beliefs.
meanings.sent2: The tragic event unchurches the community, leading to questions and doubts.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes playfully unchurch the seriousness of the religious debate.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected discovery unchurches her long-held beliefs, opening her mind to new possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The powerful speech unchurches the audience, inspiring them to seek their own truths.
